content: toy hammock abbreviations chain - chain single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet skip - skip space - space slip_stitch - slip_stitch st s - stitch es materials 150 yards worsted weight yarn or the yarn of your choice 6 5mm crochet hook gauge doesn t matter notes this pattern is written in american terms when you re finished the hammock may look really small to you - but trust me it will s-t-r-e-t-c-h a lot once you start adding the toys pattern chain 10 slip_stitch in 1st chain to form a loop chain 111 or longer depending how big you want the hammock slip_stitch in 10th chain from hook this forms the second loop row 1 chain 1 double_crochet in each chain across 101 double_crochet row 2 chain 5 turn skip 3 double_crochet double_crochet in next double_crochet *chain 3 skip next 3 double_crochet double_crochet in next double_crochet* across to the end row 3 - end chain 1 turn single_crochet in first chain 3 space chain 5 counts as double_crochet and chain 3 double_crochet in next chain 3 space *chain 3 double_crochet in next chain 3 space* ending in last chain 3 space be sure not to start working down the side of the hammock work this row until you have only one chain 3 space left ch1 turn single_crochet in chain 3 space chain 10 slip_stitch in chain 3 space to form the last loop finish off and weave in ends hang in the corner of a room i use the 3m hooks that stick on a wall and enjoy not having stuffies all over the floor anymore copyright notice this pattern is copyright of crystal benoit you are welcome to sell your finished items from this pattern however do not copy or redistribute the pattern itself in any way please provide a link to my website if you sell your finished items online if you have any questions or need help with the pattern please email me at thebenoitfive@gmail com i ll be glad to help you thank you for trying my pattern i hope you enjoy it ~ crystal
